content:
Determine the name of the compound given the following chemical formula
C6H12O6

The chemical formula C₆H₁₂O₆ represents several different compounds, known as hexoses, which are six-carbon sugars. The most common and well-known compound with this formula is glucose. However, other isomers such as fructose and galactose also share the same molecular formula. These compounds are structural isomers, meaning they have the same molecular formula but different structural arrangements.
